s.text: The tobacco/states talks broke up Wednesday, the WP reports, over the states' demands for an up-front payment of about $20 billion, twice the amount the companies offered in last year's negotiated settlement, left in limbo by the failure of the Congress to implement it.
The Wall Street Journal "Washington Wire" reports that three separate suicides by Navy officers in and around Washington in recent months have the service rattled.
The Wall Street Journal "Washington Wire" reports that three separate suicides by Navy officers in and around Washington in recent months have the service rattled.
The Wall Street Journal "Washington Wire" reports that three separate suicides by Navy officers in and around Washington in recent months have the service rattled.
But, the paper points out, there is certainly pressure to continue talking: in the form of more bills in the making that could hit the cigarette companies with a large tax surcharge.

After all the expense and complications the Times has experienced putting color pictures on the front page, it might be a little difficult for the brass to admit that the picture has something else going for it: its main colors are blue and white, giving it the moody feel of.
